attributes.action: Make significant improvements to the slip roads on the A34 in the Newbury area
attributes.additional_details:
The A34 slip roads, particularly at Highclere & Speen near Newbury, are incredibly dangerous due to their short length and dangerous angles, and given the volume of traffic & HGVs that use this road.

At peak times, the slip road at Highclere often has a queue of cars waiting to pull onto the carriageway that can't be seen as the corner approach is so sharp and the slip road is so short.

We would like significant improvements to be made in order to minimize accidents & improve safety.

We can’t accept petitions that request action at a local level. 

  

You could ask your MP to take action on your concerns about this issue, including by asking them to present a public (paper) petition about this. 

You can find contact details for your local MP here: https://members.parliament.uk/FindYourMP 

And you can find out how to ask your MP to present a public (paper) petition here: https://www.parliament.uk/get-involved/sign-a-petition/paper-petitions/ 

You could also raise this issue with your local Council, you can find their contact information here: https://www.westberks.gov.uk/contact-us
